html:
Thou shalt no more rejoice. Because of her destruction, Sidon cannot rejoice.

oppressed virgin. Sidon is portrayed as a woman, as is customary for cities referred to by Isaiah.

daughter of Zidon (Sidon). It was customary for Isaiah to call cities daughter (23:10; 37:22; 47:1).

arise, pass over to Chittim. Sidon's refugees are told to flee to Chittim, or Cyprus (compare 23:6).

there also shalt thou have no rest. In Cyprus, the refugees from Sidon will experience troubles, perhaps warfare, as they did in Sidon.
